awards:
[{'title': '2015 Student of the Year', 'description': 'Described by Ms. O’Halloran, director of the English department, as “a diligent student who always contributed fully in class and has engaged in all aspects of the English Honours Programme. Her written tasks are of an excellent standard. Keila has a strong work ethic and always demonstrates that she is committed to her studies; this is reflected in consistent achievement of higher grades in school exams.”

According to Ms. Dalton, from the French Honours Department, “Keila always strives to do her utmost best to improve her fluency in French. Keila has achieved an A1 in all of her assessments to date. This alone shows that Keila is a hard worker and is ready to take on any challenge in the future”.

The Careers Guidance Counselor of Coláiste Lorcáin, Mr. Hutton, “highly recommends Keila for any university course she would wish to pursue, as her friendly personality and politeness will help her adapt to college life, moreover, her intelligence, diligence and application to study will help her meet the rigours of Third Level Education”

According to Ms. Campbell, from the Department of History, “Keila is currently in the top percentile of the History Honours Programme. I am impressed with Keila’s authentic interest in history and her drive to self-educate. I can confirm that her work is of a high qualitative standard and her English writing skills are on a par with native speakers. Evidence of this is proven by the fact that her grades are consistently A1 (95-100%) across the board.
